title: [Large-scale] Improving e-Learning Environments through Ontology-Based Feedback Systems for Learning Objects

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Science Knowledge and Experience in Using Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: Project-based science education course operated in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze the context of science education content using the Learning Object Ontology (LOCO) framework
Acquire the skill of extracting semantic relationships between learner activities and content by applying semantic web technologies

Learners can analyze at least three instances of real-time interaction data from an online science course using the LOCO-Analyst tool and submit a course improvement report reflecting at least two derived insights within four weeks.

Learners can develop a standardized evaluation framework to analyze learning data (engagement, output scores, pre- and post-tests) for assessing the effectiveness of a science PBL course within four weeks and apply it to at least three PBL projects within a company, achieving an average evaluator satisfaction rate of 80% or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
